result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael Fonseca was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Court costs/DNA of $463 (less $101.00 bond) payable to Clerk of Courts at the rate of $50/month beginning 6/27/22.  In default of payment, referral to State Debt Collection.  Submit DNA Sample.
Restitution joint/several with 20CF150 Margaret Boyd.  Restitution paid in full.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Michael Fonseca

records.addlTxt: JOC and Payment Plan Summary returned undeliverable

records.descr: Order Collection Biological Specimen DNA Analysis

records.addlTxt: 9:44 AM  Court calls 20CM124 and 22CM21.   Defendant Michael Fonseca in court.  Attorney Edward Daniel Burke Jr. in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Brad Hansen in court for Michael Fonseca.   Rachel Race, VWC, present.  State recommends 22CM21 - $50 + costs =  $267.50 and Restitution of $399.00 joint/several.  20CM124 Dismissed read in.  Deft. advised of right to counsel on 22CM21, only represented by Atty. Hansen on 20CM124.  Deft. advises he wants to proceed w/o counsel on 22CM21.  Court allows Deft. to represent himself.  22CM21 - Deft. waives reading of complaint and enters a GUILTY Plea.  Plea quest. & waiver of rights reviewed.  Court finds plea made freely & voluntarily.  Court accepts plea.  Adjudged guilty and court orders a JOC entered into the record.  Victim rights complied with per State and VWC.  Sentence recommendations.  Court sentence as recommended:  22CM21 - $399.00 Rest. joint/several w/Margaret Boyd w/o surcharge as case 20CM124 dismiss read-in.  Costs/DNA of $463  payable at the rate of $50/month beginning 6/27/22.  In default of payment, SDC.  Submit DNA.  Case 20CM124 is dismissed and read-in.
Plea/sentencing hearing on May 26, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Atty Hansen in the office and Jordan/DA's office by phone rescheduled the P&S that was set on 5/20/2022 at 9am to 5/26/2022 at 10am, this was rescheduled at the request of the DA's office, the DA was double booked.

01:36 PM Defendant Michael Fonseca in court with attorney Brad Hansen.  Lisa Rowe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Both cases to be resolved at the same time.  ADA to put offer in writing. 22CM124 Pro Se'  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 20, 2022 at 09:00 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Michael Fonseca
Current: 35 Wilson Street, Clintonville, WI 54929 United States  (Effective: 03-17-2022)
Prior: 75 Hughes St, Clintonville, WI 54929
Defendant shall not operate a motor vehicle without a valid drivers license.

01:12 PM Defendant Michael Fonseca in court with attorney Brad Hansen.  Lisa Rowe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Complaint reviewed.  Evaluation done by SPD.  He does not qualify for SPD for this case.  Atty Hansen does represent him in 20CM21. Deft. wishes to represent himself on this case.  The cases will track eachother.    Defendant shall immediately report to the Sheriff's Department for fingerprinting and photographing.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 14, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
